dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Back in 2019, JPMorgan Chase had a staggering $2.8 trillion in assets.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Back in twenty nineteen, JPMorgan Chase had a staggering two point eight dollars trillion in assets.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The banking giant, which boasted $2.7 trillion in assets as of the 12 months ending on April 18, 2019, overtook Apple and Berkshire Hathaway to claim the top spot on the list.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and that actually pushed them ahead of Apple and Berkshire Hathaway for the top spot.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and that actually pushed them ahead of Apple and Berkshire Hathaway for the top spot.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The banking giant, which boasted $2.7 trillion in assets as of the 12 months ending on April 18, 2019, overtook Apple and Berkshire Hathaway to claim the top spot on the list.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, which is wild because Apple was still the most profitable company globally, pulling in nearly $61 billion that year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, which is wild because Apple was still the most profitable company globally, pulling in nearly sixty one dollars billion that year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Apple ranks third on the U.S. list in 2019, though it remains the most profitable public company in the world, pulling in nearly $60 billion last year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And yet, uh, only six of the top 50 U.S. companies were major banks, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And yet, uh, only six of the top fifty U.S. companies were major banks, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Though the global list, which ranks public companies using a composite score of revenue, profits, assets and market value, is dominated by banks and financial services companies, just six of the top 50 companies in the United States are major banks.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly—JPMorgan, Bank of America, Wells Fargo, Citigroup, US Bancorp, and PNC.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly-JPMorgan, Bank of America, Wells Fargo, Citigroup, U S Bancorp, and P N C.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Citigroup, US Bancorp, and PNC join JPMorgan, Bank of America, and Wells Fargo round out the group of major banks, of which all but PNC saw rising profits due in large part to tax cuts set in motion by President Trump in 2017.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And most of those banks saw profits rise thanks to those 2018 tax cuts.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And most of those banks saw profits rise thanks to those twenty eighteen tax cuts.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Citigroup, US Bancorp, and PNC join JPMorgan, Bank of America, and Wells Fargo round out the group of major banks, of which all but PNC saw rising profits due in large part to tax cuts set in motion by President Trump in 2017.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Meanwhile, Berkshire Hathaway fell 11 spots to number 12 after that Kraft Heinz writedown.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Meanwhile, Berkshire Hathaway fell eleven spots to number twelve after that Kraft Heinz writedown.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Notably, Berkshire Hathaway has fallen 11 spots since last year, when it tied with Apple for the number one spot. Warren Buffet's storied holding company ranks 12th this year thanks to a major writedown (courtesy of its holding Kraft Heinz) in the fourth quarter of 2018.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, that was a huge hit in late 2018. But then you've got Citigroup bouncing back up to number 7 after some rough overseas losses the year before.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, that was a huge hit in late twenty eighteen. But then you've got Citigroup bouncing back up to number seven after some rough overseas losses the year before.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Citigroup, on the other hand, ranked 190 on an extended list in 2018 thanks to losses related to assets overseas, rocketed back up to number 7.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: The market itself was all over the place—the S&P swung like 1,100 points in a single day at one point.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The market itself was all over the place-the S&P swung like eleven hundred points in a single day at one point.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: U.S. stocks had a tumultuous year in 2018, especially during the final month of the year when the S&P 500 swung 1,000 points in a single trading day.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And with trade tensions flaring up again between the U.S. and China, investors were definitely nervous about whether that volatility was here to stay.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And with trade tensions flaring up again between the U.S. and China, investors were definitely nervous about whether that volatility was here to stay.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Markets rebounded during the first quarter of 2019, but the escalation of trade war tensions between the United States and China in recent weeks have investors wondering if that volatility and trade uncertainty, sure to have an enormous impact on American companies, is the new normal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's interesting though—despite all that, the top 50 U.S. companies still had a combined market cap over $13 trillion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's interesting though-despite all that, the top fifty U.S. companies still had a combined market cap over thirteen dollars trillion.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The top 50 U.S. companies have a combined market capitalization of more than $12 trillion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, which just shows how massive these giants are, even when things get shaky.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, which just shows how massive these giants are, even when things get shaky.
